answers.answer: I have type 1 diabetes and if you continue to have high blood sugars it can harm the baby causing birth defects and even death. It is important to monitor yourself and eat as healthy as possible. Walk as much as you can. Are they having you monitor your blood sugars? If it gets worse they may even recommend insulin injections to control the high blood sugars. I too have trouble eating healthy but I have to make a choice for my unborn child. I say get bagged salads and make chicken and make healthy chicken salad or some other meat you might like with greens etc. You can get canned beans and add to veggies and that's healthy. Try to avoid a lot of breads and starches. I know it is hard in this day n age but do it for you and the baby. Good luck.

I had gestational diabetes with my first pregnancy. So bad i had to inject insulin everyday. Its horrible. I put on sooo much weight. I was induced early because of it. You NEED to be more conscious of what you are eating. After baby was born i didnt have it, but newly pregnant again im eating healthy and doing all i can to prevent it happening again

question: I just turned 23 weeks today and  I have pregnancy diabetes ...I havent been eating right   its not that I dont try  its that I dont have the money to eat right  like I want to I try to eat baked instead of fried and no sodas and sweets ...I dont have a job right now and I try to walk more and  drink a lot of water ...I just dont want nothing to happen to my son..is he gonna b ok? Pls give me your advice !!
title: scared pls help!!
